intro: Aeschynomene arabica, commonly known as wild coffee, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which also includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in open woodlands or along roadsides. Aeschynomene arabica is not typically cultivated for commercial use but is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
